column4: Hi,  I have a sony camera that I wish to automount in PTP mode (assume no other mode available). Right now I can do that by hand  "gphotofs /mnt/camera". Is there a udev rule to automount in PTP mode already ? Or any other way to auto mount ?
udev doesn't mount, hal does
actually hal informs gnome to mount to be more exact
okay. I see... so, is there a way to ask hal to automount ?
oh okay
but I could use the RUN to do the mounting can't I ?
run ? sorry, I don't follow. I'm just checking ou the hal interaction process now
I could say KERNEL="usb" RUN+="mount script"
right?
from within hal ?
no, in a udev rules file
I've never used "run" before in udev so wouldn't like to guess, but thats not really udev's job. Try it though if you like
okay.
What will be the proper way then ?
to set a hal trigger on a udev event
okay... how do I do that?
I'm just reading up now. Feel free to read up on hal and beat me to it
:) sure
libjs is javascript as I recall
yes, but I want to know the package name .. I have tried to list all possible JS packages and the files they provide still I donot have any answers for /usr/lib/libjs.so
what wants that file,. it looks like it's a file that redhat are packaging up seperate from the jvm package
what is complaining about that file I should say

what you say may be right. Since packages.ubuntu.com cannot find any file with this name. It is a JS devel library that I need to compile MediaTomb with. The problem apparently it seems is Ubuntu's JS package as it is got from xulrunner not from spidermonkey :(
